intro: Phaca abbreviata, commonly known as the short-stemmed phaca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, adapting to saline and well-drained environments. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Phaca abbreviata is often found in shrubland and coastal dunes, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
